channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Kisses yes, Bezos No,' protesters say, as Bezos wedding stirs controversy in Venice
item.description: Protesters denounced the three-day celebrations for the wedding between Jeff Bezos and his wife Lauren Sanchez Bezos as a symbol of rising inequality ...

item.title: 6/28: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Lightning, hailstorm forces hundreds of canceled flights in Atlanta; California wildlife caregivers use bear costumes to help orphaned bear cub

item.title: Serbia police clash with anti-government protesters in Belgrade
item.description: President Aleksandar Vucic - populist and close to Russia - has faced months of protests and alleges a foreign coup plot.

item.title: I feel like I've been gaslit - like the life I had before the war was made up
item.description: The private thoughts and reflections of a young woman whose life has altered course.

item.title: Senate advances Trump's "big, beautiful bill" in narrow vote
item.description: Congress is racing to meet a self-imposed July 4 deadline to send the tax and spending bill to the president.

item.title: Thousands party at Budapest Pride in clear message to Orban
item.description: A giant crowd throngs the Hungarian capital, championing LGBT rights and defying PM Viktor Orban.

item.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (June 29)
item.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the Emmy-winning program, hosted by Jane Pauley.

item.title: Senate Republicans advance Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' but final vote hangs in balance
item.description: Senate leadership twisted arms for an initial vote on the spending plan, which still needs final approval.

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: Tropical Depression 2 forms in Gulf, expected to strengthen before reaching Mexico
item.description: If it does reach tropical storm status, which would be under the name Tropical Storm Barry, it would become the second named storm of the Atlantic hur...

item.title: A pioneering doctor remembers India leader Indira Gandhi's final moments
item.description: Sneh Bhargava, AIIMS New Delhi's only woman director, was called upon to treat Gandhi after she was shot in 1984.

item.title: Man kicked and injured a CBP beagle during airport baggage search
item.description: An Egyptian traveler who kicked the 25-pound dog was ordered to pay its vet fees and turn himself in for removal from the country.

item.title: J.M. Smucker plans to remove artificial colors from its jams and other products
item.description: Smucker joins a growing number of big food companies that have announced plans to eliminate artificial dyes.

item.title: Authors petition publishers to curtail their use of AI
item.description: The open letter and accompanying petition asking publishers "to make a pledge that they will never release books that were created by machines" garner...

item.title: Around 100,000 march in Budapest Pride event in defiance of Hungary's ban
item.description: Marchers gambled with potential police intervention and fines to participate in the annual Budapest Pride, which was outlawed by a law passed by Prime...

item.title: In words and photos, rural Alaska residents reflect on their village’s sustainable practices
Protesters line highway in Florida Everglades to oppose ‘Alligator Alcatraz’
Chrysler recalls some 2022-2025 Pacifica and Voyager vehicles to fix a potential airbag issue
item.description: Chrysler is voluntarily recalling some of its 2022-2025 Pacifica and Voyager vehicles to replace their side curtain airbags, if needed.
